@graph.name: Homemade Coffee Ice Cream Recipe - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: Rich, ultra-creamy, with a bold coffee flavor — this is the best homemade coffee ice cream recipe! It's easy to make with only 7 ingredients!

@graph.name: How do you make coffee ice cream from scratch?

acceptedAnswer.text: Follow this recipe! It's so easy!

@graph.name: Can you put coffee grounds in ice cream?

acceptedAnswer.text: I do not recommend doing this. Use brewed coffee or instant coffee granules (as called for in this recipe) to make the best coffee ice cream.

@graph.name: What can I substitute for instant coffee in a recipe?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can use espresso powder in place of instant coffee.

@graph.name: Does coffee ice cream keep you awake?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you use caffeinated coffee you definitely run the risk of it effecting your ability to fall asleep. To avoid this, use decaffeinated instant coffee.

@graph.name: Best Coffee Ice Cream Recipe
@graph.description: Rich, ultra-creamy, with a bold coffee flavor — this is the best homemade coffee ice cream recipe! It's easy to make with only 7 ingredients and is better than store-bought or ice cream parlor varieties.

video.name: Coffee Ice Cream
video.description: Rich, ultra-creamy, with a bold coffee flavor — this is the best homemade coffee ice cream recipe! It's easy to make with only 7 ingredients and is better than store-bought or ice cream parlor varieties.

recipeIngredient: 1 to 1 ½ TBS instant coffee ((decaf or regular))

recipeInstructions.text: Warm half and half, sugar and salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat, whisking to dissolve sugar.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm half and half, sugar and salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat, whisking to dissolve sugar.

recipeInstructions.text: Beat egg yolks in a small mixing bowl, add ½ cup of the warm mixture to the egg yolks and whisk to combine. Then add that mixture to the half and half on the stovetop.
recipeInstructions.name: Beat egg yolks in a small mixing bowl, add ½ cup of the warm mixture to the egg yolks and whisk to combine. Then add that mixture to the half and half on the stovetop.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk in coffee granulates until dissolved.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk in coffee granulates until dissolved.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook over medium-low heat stirring constantly until the mixture thickens slightly – just barely sticking to the back of a spatula or until it reaches 170 degrees F.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook over medium-low heat stirring constantly until the mixture thickens slightly – just barely sticking to the back of a spatula or until it reaches 170 degrees F.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the heavy cream into a bowl with a fine mesh strainer on top of the bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the heavy cream into a bowl with a fine mesh strainer on top of the bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Strain the custard into the heavy cream. Discard what is left on the strainer.
recipeInstructions.name: Strain the custard into the heavy cream. Discard what is left on the strainer.

recipeInstructions.text: Add vanilla extract, stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add vanilla extract, stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer to an airtight container and cool completely in the fridge (preferably overnight).
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer to an airtight container and cool completely in the fridge (preferably overnight).

recipeInstructions.text: Pour mixture into an ice cream maker and churn until frozen (about 30-40 minutes).
recipeInstructions.name: Pour mixture into an ice cream maker and churn until frozen (about 30-40 minutes).

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer to an airtight container and freeze completely, about 4 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer to an airtight container and freeze completely, about 4 hours.
